üöÄ Getting Started

Prompt Cortex is a Chrome extension that helps you manage and use AI prompts efficiently. Whether you're a beginner or power user, this guide will help you get the most out of the platform.

üéØ What You Can Do

  • Store and organize AI prompts with tags and categories
  • Quickly copy prompts to use in ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI tools
  • Track which prompts you use most often
  • Create custom prompts tailored to your workflow
  • Import and export your prompt library

üéØ Using Prompts

Opening the Sidebar

The sidebar is your main interface for accessing prompts:

  • Click the extension icon in your Chrome toolbar (looks like a puzzle piece)
  • The sidebar will open on the right side of your browser
  • You can resize it by dragging the left edge

Finding and Using Prompts

  • Search: Use the search bar at the top to find prompts by title, content, or tags
  • Browse: Scroll through your prompts organized by favorites and usage
  • Select: Click on any prompt to view its full content in the detail section
  • Copy: Use the "Copy" button below the prompt content to copy to your clipboard
  • Insert: Use the "Insert" button to insert the prompt into the active tab
  • Favorite: Use the star icon on each prompt to mark frequently used prompts

Prompt Organization

Prompts are automatically organized into sections:

  • Favorites: Your starred prompts appear at the top
  • Active Prompts: All visible, non-hidden prompts
  • Hidden Prompts: Prompts you've temporarily hidden (click to expand)
  • Deleted Prompts: Prompts in the recycle bin (click to expand)

Prompt Actions

Each prompt has action buttons that appear on the right side:

  • Star Icon: Mark/unmark as favorite
  • Eye Icon: Hide/show the prompt
  • Clone Icon: Create a copy of the prompt
  • Delete Icon: Move to recycle bin (only for user-created prompts)

üìù Managing Your Prompts

Creating New Prompts

  1. Open the Options page (right-click extension icon ‚Üí Options)
  2. In the right panel, click "New Prompt"
  3. Fill in the title, content, and tags
  4. Click "Save Prompt"

Editing Existing Prompts

  1. Select the prompt from the dropdown in the editor
  2. Make your changes to title, content, or tags
  3. Click "Save Prompt"
  4. Note: Starter prompts cannot be edited

Adding and Managing Tags

  • Add tags: Type in the tags field and press Enter
  • Remove tags: Click the √ó button on any tag
  • Tag suggestions: Use descriptive, lowercase tags like "email", "writing", "code-review"

Cloning Prompts

Create copies of existing prompts to use as templates:

  1. Find the prompt you want to clone
  2. Click the clone button (üìã) on the prompt card
  3. The new prompt will have "(Copy)" added to the title
  4. Edit the clone as needed

üóÇÔ∏è Organization Features

Hiding Prompts

Temporarily remove prompts from view without deleting them:

  • Click the hide button (üëÅÔ∏è) on any prompt
  • Hidden prompts move to the "Hidden Prompts" section
  • Click the hide button again to make them visible
  • Great for decluttering without losing work

Deleting and Restoring

  • Delete: Click the delete button (üóëÔ∏è) to move prompts to the recycle bin
  • Restore: Find deleted prompts in the "Deleted Prompts" section and click restore
  • Permanent deletion: Deleted prompts are automatically removed after your set time period
  • Note: Starter prompts cannot be deleted

Auto-Purge Settings

Control how long deleted prompts stay in the recycle bin:

  1. Go to Options ‚Üí Advanced Settings
  2. Choose from 7, 14, 30, 60, or 90 days
  3. After this period, prompts are permanently deleted

üìä Analytics & Insights

Usage Tracking

Monitor how you're using your prompts:

  • Total usage: See how many times you've used prompts overall
  • Top prompts: View your 5 most frequently used prompts
  • Performance insights: Identify which prompts are most effective

Viewing Analytics

  1. Open the Options page
  2. Look for the "Usage Analytics" section on the left
  3. View your total usage count and top prompts

üîÑ Import & Export

Exporting Your Prompts

Backup your prompt library or share with others:

  1. Go to Options ‚Üí Import & Export
  2. Click "Export All Prompts"
  3. Choose where to save the JSON file
  4. Note: Only user-created prompts are exported (starter prompts are not included)

Importing Prompts

Add prompts from other installations or shared files:

  1. Click "Import Prompts"
  2. Select your JSON file
  3. The system will merge new prompts with existing ones
  4. Conflicts are resolved automatically (newer versions win)

Using the Meta Prompt

Convert existing prompts to the correct format:

  1. Click "Copy Meta Prompt"
  2. Paste it into ChatGPT along with your existing prompt
  3. ChatGPT will convert it to the proper JSON format
  4. Save the output and import it

üí° Best Practices

Organizing Your Library

  • Use descriptive titles: Make it easy to find prompts at a glance
  • Tag everything: Add 3-5 relevant tags to each prompt
  • Favorites wisely: Mark only your most-used prompts as favorites
  • Regular cleanup: Hide or delete prompts you no longer use

Creating Effective Prompts

  • Be specific: Clear instructions produce better results
  • Include examples: Show the AI what you want
  • Set expectations: Specify output format and length
  • Test and refine: Use prompts multiple times and improve them

Workflow Tips

  • Backup regularly: Export your library monthly
  • Use favorites: Keep your go-to prompts easily accessible
  • Organize by project: Use tags to group related prompts
  • Version control: Clone prompts before making major changes

üîß Tips & Tricks

Keyboard Shortcuts

  • Enter in tag input: Quickly add tags
  • Tab navigation: Move between form fields
  • Escape: Clear selections and return to default state

Search Strategies

  • Partial matches: Search for parts of words or phrases
  • Tag search: Find prompts by specific tags
  • Source filtering: Filter by starter vs. user-created prompts

Advanced Features

  • Collapsible sections: Use arrows to show/hide hidden and deleted prompts
  • Quick access: Use the sidebar for frequent operations
  • Prompt selection: Click on prompts to view full content and use action buttons

‚ùì Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  • Prompts not loading: Try reloading the extension
  • Changes not saving: Check if you're editing a starter prompt (these can't be modified)
  • Import errors: Ensure your JSON file follows the correct format
  • Sidebar not opening: Check if the extension is enabled

Getting Help

If you continue to have issues:

  1. Check the browser console for error messages
  2. Try reloading the extension
  3. Ensure you're using the latest version
  4. Check that all permissions are granted
